descriptionHtml:
[b][size=7][color=dodgerblue]Simple Teleport Magic[/b][/size][/color]





[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Description[/b][/size][/color]

This is a simple [b]\"Mark and Recall\"[/b] style teleport magic I created as a component for a different mod. I know there are many teleportaion magics 

out there in Nexus(I found it out after finishing the mod. lol). This might not be a greatest mod out there but I decided to upload it anyway since I 

spent a lot of time in this. This mod was to be included in a future player home mod that I\'m working on right now, but it was done so well, I decided 

to share it separately.

[b][color=red][size=4]Note - There have been many changes to the spell on the latest update to version 1.0. So please make sure to read the change log, 

as well as installation/update instruction.[/b][/color][/size]



[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]What it does[/b][/size][/color]

This mod basically adds a teleport magic with different configurations you can do in-game. The magic is a \"Mark and Recall\" style which you set the 

detination beforehand and use the spell to teleport to pre-defined location.

Some of the features are

[list] [*]10 markable location slot 

[*]Return to original location 

[*]Autosave after teleportation 

[*]Teleport with followers(Theoratically [b][color=red]unlimited[/b][/color] number of followers) 

[*]View marked location with spell

[*]View marked location on your map/compass and check the markers status if they\'re enabled or disabled (Newly added feature)

[*]Summon your followers to your location (Newly added feature)  [/list]


Once installed, the mod will place a spell in [url=http://uesp.net/wiki/Skyrim:Farengar_Secret-Fire]Farengar[/url]\'s vending list.





[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Spell List[/b][/size][/color]


[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14933-1-1334688375.png[/img]

[b][size=3][color=lightskyblue]Teleport Main Spell[/b][/size][/color]

Unlike the previous version of the spell, now there is only one spell that can be used to Mark/Clear locations and Recall/Return to locations. This 

spell will also include 2 extra feature. One is Summon Followers, which will summon all of your current registered followers to your location. The 

other is the Show Marker, which will place bright orb of light at the marked location. Instead of being concentration spell, now it is a turn on/off 

spell which can be operated with the touch of a button. Now this spell introduces more limitations than previous version in order to discourage abuse 

of the spell. The spell will also now cost around 3000 golds depending on your level. 

[list][*]You can mark/clear up to 10 locations. No limit on where mark can be placed other than proximity of each other.

[*]You can teleport to locations marked previously. 

[*]You can teleport back to your original location.

[*]Your followers will teleport with you if you have enough Magicka for them.

[*]You can summon your followers to your location.

[*]You can view your marked location. The spell will place bright orb of light so you can see it from distance.

[*]The spell will now provide experience in Alteration according to mana usage.

[*]Spell now does not require Magicka to initiate. But if you do not have enough Magicka when you select Recall/Return or Summon option, you will not 

be able to execute the spell.

[/list]
Spellbook cost : 3000
Magicka cost : Recall - [80 + (10 X # of follower)],  Summon - [40 + (10 X # of follower)]   (Constant - Unaffected by skill/perk)
Single-hand spell
School : Alteration
Required skill : Alteration 25





[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14933-2-1334688377.png[/img]


[b][size=3][color=lightskyblue]Register Follower spell (This spell stays unchanged)[/b][/size][/color]

Register Follower spell will allow you to register(mark) your followers so they can teleport with you. Cast this spell while pointing your crosshair at 

your follower you wish to register. If you have successfully registered your follower with this spell, a notification will show saying that follower 

will now follow your teleport. If you use this spell on a follower who is not currently following you, or any other person, it will say they are not 

following you and will not register them. If you dismiss a follower, they will not teleport with you even if they are registered with this spell. If 

you want to unregister any follower, just cast the spell again on them and it will unregister them from the spell, and will show a message saying they 

will not follow your teleport any longer. ([b][color=red]Note[/b][/color] : They have to be currently following you in order for them to unregister) 

This spell can (theoratically) register unlimited amount of followers.

Spellbook cost : It is not acquirable from Farengar any longer. Please see Setting Stone section.
Magicka cost : 5
Single-hand spell
School : Alteration
Required skill : Alteration level 25




[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14933-3-1334688377.png[/img]


[b][size=3][color=lightskyblue]Setting spell[/b][/size][/color]

AutoSave Setting spell is now replaced with Setting spell, which includes the AutoSave setting within itself. Setting and feature for AutoSave feature 

stays same as before. AutoSave\'s default is still \"autosave after every teleportation\". Can be turned off or replaced with new saves instead. Setting 

spell now includes setting for Proximity limitation, as well as activation of the new feature \"Map Marker\". This spell also includes simple status 

report of your spell\'s system. For detail, please see Setting Stone section.

Spellbook cost : It is not acquirable from Farengar any longer. Please see Setting Stone section.
Magicka cost : None
Lesser Power
School : None
Required skill : None



[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14933-1-1334688640.jpg[/img]


[b][size=3][color=lightskyblue]Setting Stone[/b][/size][/color]

The setting stone for this spell is located behind Breezehome in Whiterun, alongside the castle wall. Please refer to the picture if you\'re having hard 

time finding it. This stone is basically the \"Command Center\" of the spell. You can add, remove spell as you see fit, or change settings of the spell. 

You will need to acquire the Teleport Main spell first from Farengar, in order to activate the stone. When you\'ve bought/learned the spell, activate 

this stone to access the further feature of the spell. First, you\'ll be given the choice to add or remove the 3 spells included in the mod. Which are

[list][*]Teleport Main Spell - Used for Mark/Recall/Summon
[*]Register Follower Spell - Used to register followers for teleportation
[*]Setting Spell - Basically a portable version of the Setting Stone, only without add/remove spell function[/list]

There\'s also a setting menu which you can change various setting of the spell. This setting menu can also be accessed with the Setting Spell, which can 

be acquired from this stone. Currently changeable settings are,

[b][size=2][color=Dodgerblue]Proximity setting[/b][/size][/color]
Whenever you place a mark on the location, you have a 1000 Game Unit(approaximately 20 feet) distance limit on how close the marks can be placed each 

other. Also, marker itself reserves the radius of distance of 400 Game Unit(approaximately 8 feet) from itself. Within this radius, you cannot teleport 

to the respective marker, but you can teleport back to original location. Which means, you can be within 1000 GU(Game Unit) away from the marker, and 

still be able to teleport to the marker you\'re close by, although you won\'t be able to place another marker there. And when you\'re within 400 GU(Game 

Unit) range of the marker, you won\'t be able to teleport to that marker, but instead, you\'re allowed to teleport back to your original location. For 

easier understanding, I\'ve included the diagram below.

[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/images/14933-1-1334683592.png[/img]

Basically, you cannot mark new locations in [b][color=dodgerblue]blue circle[/b][/color]. And you cannot teleport to the respective marker within [b]

[color=red]red circle[/b][/color]. You can, however, teleport to another [b][color=red]red circle[/b][/color] from a [b][color=red]red circle[/b]

[/color]. You can ONLY teleport back to original location if you\'re within [b][color=red]red circle[/b][/color].

However, with the Proximity setting, this limit can be changed. Currently there is 2 options. 

[list][*]Marker placement limit can be switched between 1000 GU, and 2000 GU
[*]Marker effective range can be switched between 400 GU, and 800 GU
[*]Return teleport limit can be turned off to allow you to teleport to original location from anywhere in Skyrim[/list]


[b][size=2][color=Dodgerblue]Map Marker Setting[/b][/size][/color]

Map Marker can be activated here and then later be disabled, or enabled through this menu. Map Marker will activate a permenant quest to allow you to 

see which marker is placed where, and which marker is enabled/disabled by using quest objectives. In order to use this feature, first activate this 

feature through this menu, and activate/highlight the quest from your journal. And it will show all the currently placed marker on your map/compass. 

Within the quest description, it will also tell you which marker is enabled/disabled. Disabling this feature will remove all the quest objectives and 

quest from your journal and can be enabled again through this menu.


[b][size=2][color=Dodgerblue]AutoSave Setting[/b][/size][/color]

This setting remains unchanged from previous version and is now just integrated into the setting menu as sub-menu. Whenver you use Teleport Main spell, 

the spell will automatically autosave each time you teleport to a location. This feature can be turned off to do nothing, or replace it by new save, 

which will create new save file each time you teleport. Default setting is \"AutoSave\".

[b][size=2][color=Dodgerblue]Status Report[/b][/size][/color]

This menu will show you simple basic status report of the spell. 
[list][*]Currently enabled/disabled markers
[*]Number followers registered with the spell
[*]Current proximity limitation setting
[*]AutoSave feature\'s current setting[/list]


All of the features under \"Setting\" menu from Setting Stone, can also be accessed through \"Setting\" lesser power.






[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Installation[/b][/size][/color]

Installation is very simple. You could either,

[list] [*]Download with Nexus Mod Manager and activate them.

[*]Download manually and add to Nexus Mod Manager, and then activate them.

[*]Download manually, extract the files, and place both .bsa and .esp file in the Skyrim/Data/ folder manually and activate them on the launcher.

[/list]
[b][size=2][color=red]If you\'re updating from 0.9 version, please follow instructions below instead.[/b][/size][/color]

Because of the major changes in spell system and its scripts, it is highly recommanded to have clean save file before you update the mod. This does 

[b][color=red]NOT[/b][/color] mean you need to start new game. All you need to do is,

[list][*]Uninstall and remove the old version 0.9.
[*]Run the game, load your save file. Ignore warning about \"missing contents\". You\'ll be fine.
[*]When the game loads, create new save file, and then exit the game.
[*]Now install and activate the new version.
[*]Load your new save file, and start playing. [/list]

(You will need to purchase the spell again from Farengar, and I\'m sorry for making you spend more money on him.)




[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Compatibility[/b][/size][/color]

Compatible with UFO - Ultimate Follower Overhaul

There is some issues with Deus Mons, and Riverside Lodge. Please see Known Issues section.

Should be compatible with any other mod. Please report if there is any compatibility issues.





[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Known Issues[/b][/size][/color]

[list] [*]Apparently followers will teleport with you even when you did not register them with [b][color=silver]\"Register Follower\"[/b][/color] spell. 

I am unsure what\'s causing this but they will appear at random entry point(door) in the cell(room, city, or dungeon) player has teleported to. When you 

register the followers with the spell though, they will work nicely and will appear right next to you instead of some random door of somebody\'s house. 

[*]This spell can be very over powered depending on your use, and can possibly break your game or quest. So please use this responsively. I didn\'t 

place any safety measures on purpose, so you can have maximum freedom with it. You can even place location marker in Pelagius\' mind, or even Sovengarde 

and return there later on. The rule of thumb I would like to suggest you is that you don\'t use this while in quest and/or dungeon, unless you\'re 

absolutely sure you won\'t break the game/quest and won\'t miss anything.

[*]The autosave feature will not save before the teleport, rather, it will save after the teleport. I tried to find a workaround to this issue, but I 

was unable to find a solution. So I suggest you to save often, and utilize \"Quicksave\" before you use teleport spell, if you\'re unsure whether to use 

it or not.

[*]Currently there is a CTD issues with Deus Mons(Living Room cell), and Riverside Lodge(Whole interior cell) when teleporting from their affected 

cells to city exterior(ex: Whiterun, Solitude). Other than this combination (Deus Mons living room -> City exterior, Riverside Lodge interior -> City 

exterior), it works nicely. Please keep in mind, this is the issue caused by the cells themselves, as this issue is persistant with every single 

teleportation mods out there.

[*]The spell is currently unaffected by Alteration skill or perks, and will not reduce the Magicka cost even if you have high Alteration skill level.

[*]Please let me know if you find any.[/list]




[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Change Log[/b][/size][/color]

1.0 - 

[list][*]Joined Mark/Clear, Recall/Return, Show Marker spell into a single spell with menu system.
[*]Added new feature Map Marker, allowing you to see which marker is placed where.
[*]Added new feature Summon Follower, allowing you to summon your registered followers to your location.
[*]Added various setting options.
[*]Added a Setting Stone, which can be used to change the setting of the spell.
[*]Added Setting spell, which contains all the setting menus of Setting Stone. (Can be acquired from Setting Stone) 
[*]Spell now costs no Magicka to initiate, but will cost Magicka when Recall/Return/Summon command is initiated. 
[*]Spell now give proper experience to Alteration according to mana use of the spell.[/list]

0.9 - 

[list][*]Initial release[/list]



[b][size=5][color=lightskyblue]Credits[/b][/size][/color]

Bethesda for such an epic game and tool

Special thanks to [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/modules/members/index.php?id=229639]Benrahir[/url] for Beta testing and suggestions. Couldn\'t have done it without him.

All of you guys using the mod. I hope you enjoy it. :smile:
